bib.title: Computational aspects of social network analysis
bib.author: Kazienko, Przemyslaw and Alhajj, Reda and Srivastava, Jaideep
bib.abstract: The interdisciplinary research field commonly called Social Network Analysis (SNA) has attracted many scientists from various disciplines from physics, sociology, anthropology, psychology, management, and also computer science. Various methodologies used in different disciplines are complementary to computational methods used to process data about human activities, profiles, or direct social relationships. Users of IT systems leave their traces in most of these systems and the Internet is the largest source of data about human
